fpa-test/jasmine/test/sap/fpa/ui/bundles.jiraSummary: Loading models in presentation after opening new browser fails

Loading presentation after browser restart did not work

What and how:
- oFetchModelPromise resolved to an object and not a string, because
  we are going to join all the models in the array with a "," we need to
  make sure all elements of the aModels array are strings.
- Provide function that ensures all models are pushed as strings

fpa-test/jasmine/test/sap/fpa/ui/bundles.jiraSummary: [browser cache] after turn on the file model in repo toggle, still use the old browser cache, JS error shows up
fpa-test/jasmine/test/sap/fpa/ui/bundles.fullMessage:
Fix the issue of stale cache model after the model repo migration

------------------------------------------------------------------------
*what*
------------------------------------------------------------------------
- User could have model metadata cached before the model
file repo migration. Browser cache did not handle the case
properly and return the old cache for models migrated to repo,
hence causing runtime js error.

------------------------------------------------------------------------
*why*
------------------------------------------------------------------------
- Because server side browser cache validation checks for the
model timestamp from the firefly metatdata table which is not
cleared/updated with the model repo migration, hence the old
cache before the migration is staill considered valid by the
timestamp comparison.
- Although the table timestamp is cleared after wave upgrade
deployment, if the repo migration happens within the same wave,
the runtime error will still occur when we return the old objManager
model cache after the model repo migration, as the client expects
the model metadata be returned from contenlib with different format.

------------------------------------------------------------------------
*how*
------------------------------------------------------------------------
- Add in the model cache metadata an additional flag to indicate
whether the cached model is from file repo. The default value is
false for the existing cache generated before wave 2019.03 where
the model file repo migration is not available.
- When retrieving model metadata cache, perform a pre-validation
to check the flag in model cache vs whether the model is migrated.

PS2: fix unittests

------------------------------------------------------------------------
*testing*
------------------------------------------------------------------------
- Before model repo migration, perform the following:
1) view a story with data model used, make sure there is cache
for the model;
2) view a presentation with multiple topics, switch between topics,
and make sure there is cache for the models used in the topics;

- After the migration, in the same browser, test the following:
View the same story, and make sure:
1) the model metadata request is a cache miss at the first time,
2) the cache is updated with the isFromRepo set to true;
3) the new browser cache is used in the 2nd time without request to
the server;
View the same presentation, and make sure:
1) the same behavior of the model metadata requests described above;
View the same presentation, and make sure:
------------------------------------------------------------------------
*commit info*
------------------------------------------------------------------------

Change-Id: Ie5790457f71c2ce0dea79ac1512587691868382b
workstream: lumira
jira: FPA14-9386
action: fix
fpa-test/jasmine/test/sap/fpa/ui/bundles.jiraDescription:
1. create a story with any chart
 2. open the story multiple times -> the story and models stored into browser cache
 3. turn on model file in repo:
 * 1. turn on the toggle INFRA_MODELS_IN_REPO and INFRA_MIR_PRE_MIGRATION and INFRA_MIR_MIGRATE_CONTENT
 * 2. migrate the content to the file repo using the following tenant upgrade command in the installer (use Hana system user credantial)
 http://<MDC>/sap/fpa/services/installer/installer.xsjs?command=upgrade&log=true
 http://<MDC>/sap/fpa/services/installer/installer.xsjs?command=postUpgradeTenant&log=true

4. open the same story in the same browser

Observe that there is a JS error shows up, see the screenshot
 but after we clean up the browser cache, and then open the story, no any error

the reason it after turn on file model in repo toggle, the browser still use the old browser cache(file model in repo toggle off browser cache), we should clean up the old cache after turn on file model in repo
fpa-test/jasmine/test/sap/fpa/ui/bundles.shortMessage: Fix the issue of stale cache model after the model repo migration

fpa-test/jasmine/test/sap/fpa/ui/pa/unit.jiraSummary: [Examine] Cannot expand on the measure/dimension in table of examine with blended model
fpa-test/jasmine/test/sap/fpa/ui/pa/unit.fullMessage:
[examine] Can't drill on measures in examine table

What:
In a blended chart, drill isn't supported on measures.
We won't support them in the examine table for blended
charts either.
Instead, we want to hide the drill icon on measures
in this scenario.

How:
- Implement isMeasureDrillSupported() in DataRegion.
- Use the function in TableCell to check whether to
  show the drill icon.

Testing:
Added unit test, updated integration test, manual testing.

PS4:
Address comment.

jira: FPA51-3257
workstream: apdkpi

fpa-test/jasmine/test/sap/fpa/ui/pa/unit.jiraSummary: Shared Versions are not deleted for all users, after being deleted
fpa-test/jasmine/test/sap/fpa/ui/pa/unit.fullMessage:
Update VersionManagementPanel on deleted shared version

When the FireflyQuery yields a DELETE_VERSION error, the
VersionManagementPanel is forced to reload its cache and update, to
prevent erroneous display of the deleted version.

PS1: Solution moved to _updateVersionMgmtPanel. Tests have not been
adjusted yet.

PS2: A few errors removed. The unit test has been refactored.

PS3: The solution was reimplemented to avoid refreshes on each cell
click. Now the FireflyQueryErrorService triggers a event handler in the
data region, which was added by the DynamicTableControl and is located
in the table controller. This approach allows the processing of the
error right where it occurs and does not couple the controller, the data
region and the firefly query error service with each other.

PS4: Some minor formatting changes

fpa-test/jasmine/test/sap/fpa/ui/pa/unit.fullMessage:
Keypad correctly enters 1234,56 for 1.234,56 format

* Keypad passes values in final format for cell entry, i.e. in 1234.56 format
* Table.controller::onCellEdited replaces however thousands and decimal
  separator, leading to wrong final values for 1234.56 in case of 1.234,56
  format
* onCellEdited may receive now additional parameter finalFormat which skips
  this formatting

fpa-test/jasmine/test/sap/fpa/ui/pa/unit.jiraSummary: Table fails to load with no filter options selected
fpa-test/jasmine/test/sap/fpa/ui/pa/unit.fullMessage:
Fire render complete if table has a filter error

Previously the render complete was not fired when a page or story filter
with no selected values was applied to a table. This caused the table to
fail loading on the mobile app.
It was because usually onGridAfterRender is called twice and only sends
a render complete on the second call. But if there is an error, it is
only called once (because there is no grid showing up) and therefore does
not send any render complete.

With this change if we discover a filter error in the Control we save it
to the control, so that in onGridAfterRender we can check for the
error and send a render complete in the first call.

fpa-test/jasmine/test/sap/fpa/ui/pa/unit.jiraSummary: [Table-mobile]Sort menu stays even after completion of action
fpa-test/jasmine/test/sap/fpa/ui/pa/unit.fullMessage:
Hide QuickActionMenu on mobile after a menu option has been selected

Previously the (first level) menu stayed open (to be exact: was re-opened)
after an option in the second level menu was selected (on mobile only the
action sort, drill and showUnbookedAndTotals are supported).

Now we
1) explicitly close the first level quick action menu when a sub menu
   closes
2) on a content update we do not open the quick menu action on mobile, if
   it is not open already
3) we do not change the selection on sort, drill and showUnbookedAndTotals
   (This three option were are only available on the table header which
    doesn't change on this options)

fpa-test/jasmine/test/sap/fpa/ui/pa/unit.jiraSummary: Table Alignment Unstable (1830509091, Customer Incident)
fpa-test/jasmine/test/sap/fpa/ui/pa/unit.fullMessage:
fix behaviour of word wrap and manual heights

until now manual changes to row height were completely disregarded
when word wrap was toggled on anywhere in table
add model property to keep track of user defined row heights
toggle word wrap will now only affect the selected rows regarding height
calc
the last user actions will now be applied
e.g. user sets cell to word wrap
then user changes height--> manual height is saved and applied
if user changes height and then applies wordwrap, word wrap will
overwrite height

this commit here also includes the second part of the fix
https://git.wdf.sap.corp/#/c/3755380/

jira: FPA94-357
workstream: apd
Change-Id: I3a73638bea7ae9ecbe5132306a8ea336892da9f9

The heights of the cells changes and the table moves up or down when trying to manually align different tables.
When filtering and un filtering from dimension in the table, the table row heights change.
When you navigate with dimension filter to different topics the alignment of the table you are navigating from changes.

2) re-import the model and story -> the public version is gone after re-import
3) try to publish a new public version with the same name from Step 1) ==> fails with the shown warning that the version already exists.

Expected: there should not be a complaint about a version that does not exist anymore.

fpa-test/jasmine/test/sap/fpa/ui/pa/unit.jiraSummary: [P&R][Regression] Create private version is ~500ms slower
fpa-test/jasmine/test/sap/fpa/ui/pa/unit.fullMessage:
Improve private version performance

Removed the _hardRefreshFromVMPanel in versionmanagementcallbacks.js
The call to refresh the grid on version related changes now goes through
onAfterVersionChange.
Small Fix for Refine Filter option while copying a version also included.

Change-Id: Idd3defff7b8cd7c3b8d5dfd7c8d6e12e0f0fcea8
workstream: workstream_apdkpi
jira: FPA03-13375
fpa-test/jasmine/test/sap/fpa/ui/pa/unit.jiraDescription:
*Expected behavior*
When creating a private version, the response time should be on par or better compared to previous Orca Releases

*Observed behavior*
Create private version has slowed down by ~500ms in the new build. The slow down is due to orca client will fetch the dataset consumption model that triggers other processes like re-rendering and resizing; *BEFORE* the table refresh send out the GetResponse call.

In the old build, those work (fetch dataset model, re-rendering, resizing) occurs *AFTER* table refresh has sent out that GetResponse call.
!oldBuild_createPV_timeline_2.png|thumbnail!  
In the new build, that work occurs BEFORE table refresh sending out that same GetResponse call.
!newBuild_createPV_timeline_2.png|thumbnail! 

The change is introduced by https://git.wdf.sap.corp/#/c/3469730/ 
old-build
!oldBuild_debug.png|thumbnail!
new-build
!newBuild_debug.png|thumbnail!

*Duplicate steps*
- login Orca
- open story with planning table
- create private version
fpa-test/jasmine/test/sap/fpa/ui/pa/unit.shortMessage: Improve private version performance

fpa-test/jasmine/test/sap/fpa/ui/pa/unit.jiraSummary: Unable to load initial view for explorer
fpa-test/jasmine/test/sap/fpa/ui/pa/unit.fullMessage:
Launching explorer view breaks story

Problem:
1) create a chart and launch explorer on page 1
2) a table view and make it a default view
3) create a table on page 2
4) save the story and reload.
5) launch explorer.

Cause:
If there is ever a table added to the story
then there will be some story styling preference saved
to the story. This preference will get converted to a StyleLib
when ever a DynamicTableWidget is first loaded. But explorer
uses ExplorerDTCWidget which doesn't call DynamicTableWidget.DocumentSetting
to convert the JSON to StyleLib.

Fix: Add conversion in Table.controller when story style is loaded.

- I token out the test in table.controller because it is created for
FPA03-14054 which is not complete. The test is testing
if styleLib is not instantiated then expect property of
stylelib to not be created. But at this point styleLib should
be created.

Change-Id: I28c43d49a2aeb59ab0735748869f956eecdcd0b1
jira: FPA18-2372
workstream: workstream_lumira

Steps to reproduce:

5) launch explorer.

fpa-test/jasmine/test/sap/fpa/ui/pa/unit.jiraSummary: Table in explorer view crashes at load
fpa-test/jasmine/test/sap/fpa/ui/pa/unit.fullMessage:
unit test for fix: table view in explorer crashed

Change-Id: I394b9e8fbb593e44717026321f55423823f4c7af
workstream: workstream_apdkpi
jira: FPA03-14054
fpa-test/jasmine/test/sap/fpa/ui/pa/unit.jiraDescription:
Note: I haven't been able to identify a specific set of reproduction steps, but I've attached the story model saved in the database that results in this behavior (I ended up in this state this morning with the latest code a few times).

When performing an unidentified saving workflow, the story model of the explorer view is serialized correctly but is reloaded as a generic object, not as a StyleLib instance. The isDefaultStyleExist method is therefore undefined and this crashes the table at load.

Tentative fix: https://git.wdf.sap.corp/#/c/3604929/

May need to be backported to 2018.18 since that's when APD_FORMAT_RULE_READ_ONLY was turned on.
fpa-test/jasmine/test/sap/fpa/ui/pa/unit.shortMessage: unit test for fix: table view in explorer crashed

fpa-test/jasmine/test/sap/fpa/ui/pa/unit.jiraSummary: Table in explorer view crashes at load

fix: table in explorer view crashes

workstream: workstream_apdkpi
jira: FPA03-14054
fpa-test/jasmine/test/sap/fpa/ui/pa/unit.jiraDescription:
Note: I haven't been able to identify a specific set of reproduction steps, but I've attached the story model saved in the database that results in this behavior (I ended up in this state this morning with the latest code a few times).

When performing an unidentified saving workflow, the story model of the explorer view is serialized correctly but is reloaded as a generic object, not as a StyleLib instance. The isDefaultStyleExist method is therefore undefined and this crashes the table at load.

Tentative fix: https://git.wdf.sap.corp/#/c/3604929/

May need to be backported to 2018.18 since that's when APD_FORMAT_RULE_READ_ONLY was turned on.

fpa-test/jasmine/test/sap/fpa/ui/control.jiraSummary: Measure rename not applied to member selector or table filter display
fpa-test/jasmine/test/sap/fpa/ui/control.fullMessage:
[Rename][Table]Measure rename not applied to builder panel account filter token

Unlike other filterable dimensions whose values cannot be renamed, account
filter "values" are members which can be renamed. We need to update its
displayName so that story dataset aliases can be reflected.

workstream: workstream_apdkpi
jira: FPA30-7641

fpa-test/jasmine/test/sap/fpa/ui/control.jiraSummary: Table property 'Planning Enabled' for Blended models does not work correctly
fpa-test/jasmine/test/sap/fpa/ui/control.fullMessage:
Table property 'Planning Enabled' for Blended models does not work correctly

Why/How: Blended models are not planning enabled and the Planning section
in the Builder panel should be hidden

Add unit test

Change-Id: Id29ccd30af380eb80ead0b15fb3ae2806383599c
workstream: workstream_apdkpi
jira: FPA03-15230
fpa-test/jasmine/test/sap/fpa/ui/control.jiraDescription:
Hi colleagues,

when using blended data models, the table property 'Planning enabled' seems to be buggy.

Initially the table is not input enabled even though the flag is set to true.

If you toggle the checkbox to off and then back to on, the table cells become input enabled.

However when planning on those cells an error message appears:

'All cells about to be transferred are invalid, the transfer operation will be cancelled.'

Afterwards the table reverts back to its non-input enabled state.

My best guess is, that the property should not have this effect and that it should probably be invisible.

Â 

For reproduction please use:

[https://wsappbuild-01.cnry.projectorca.cloud/sap/fpa/ui/tenants/94514/app.html#;view_id=story;storyId=7F57A2DCE8ACD4BED7C79A59BBC606F9]

Â 

User:Â [dl_59baf1557bcf849acf000005@exchange.sap.corp|mailto:dl_59baf1557bcf849acf000005@exchange.sap.corp]

Password:Â Password!!!!

Â 

Thanks and best regards,

Marius
